DOC.HEAD: Hearst Corp. Broadcasting Executive Dies
DOC.TEXT: Mickey L. Hooten, a broadcasting executive for Hearst Corp., has died of a heart attack at age 54. Hooten, who died Sunday, joined Hearst in 1974 as program manager of WTAE-TV in Pittsburgh. In 1976, he became vice president and general manager of Hearst's WISN-TV in Milwaukee. He was named general manager of television for Hearst Broadcasting in 1984 and became a corporate vice president in 1986. Hooten also worked at KTBS-TV in Shreveport, La., WTOL-TV in Toledo, Ohio, WIS-TV in Columbia, S.C., and WGHP-TV in High Point, N.C. He was a past chairman of the ABC Television Network Affiliates Board of Governors.
